text: Hi everyone! I've been reading up on using custom (non HubSpot) forms, and have noticed that only single-line text fields are accepted. We have date-pickers on our forms and multipledropdowns so we really need to capture that data. We're using external forms because we need to add an address completion tool (essentially an extra field+some javascript). Anyone have any workarounds or otherways address completion has been achieved within a HS form?
Iâ€™ve a question for a dev of HubSpot abouth the standard_headers_includes

can someone of them PM?

Thanks :heart:

Hi <@UP1VB31LM> can I ask where you saw that?  The Forms API can accept all the same field types as the built in Forms tool. There should be no issue with you doing whatever you need with your form then submitting it to HubSpot via the Forms API. Let me know if you run into any issues when doing that or if I have mis-understood the question
is it possible to change a global module to be non global after it has been created?
Only way i know is to edit it through FTP but it's a bit hacky

it's in the meta.json for the module
`"global": false,`
The HubSpot Caching system is pretty heavy. It should respond tp changes quickly but what most devs use is the HubSpot developer extension for chrome
I think I kind of remember that if you add it to a drag&drop template you can convert to a local CM
